title: Liverpool seek Mohamed Salah reassurance ahead of FIFA Club World Cup
text:

Liverpool's political fears have been eased and the club have been told that Mohamed Salah will be treated in the exact same way as his team-mates when they travel to Qatar for the Club World Cup.

The Premier League club had fears that Salah's presence at December's tournament would be used for propaganda purposes after Egypt cut off diplomatic relations with Qatar in 2017 as part of a Middle East-wide blockade.

But the Daily Mail has claimed that Liverpool have been reassured that Salah, arguably Egypt's most high-profile sportsman, is safe to travel to Qatar and there will be no diplomatic ramifications.

Indeed, the club have been reassured that Salah will be treated in the same way as his team-mates when they bid for more silverware.

(Image: REUTERS)

Salah has visited Qatar on a number of occasions in recent years due to his close friendship with Mohamed Aboutrika, the former Egypt international who is now a pundit for the beIN Sports channel.

Last month the forward was embroiled in another storm with the Egyptian FA - after the organisation failed to vote in FIFA’s Best awards.

The Liverpool star removed all reference to playing for his country from his social media accounts, as a major row brewed in his home country.

(Image: X90179)

There are even fears within the country that Salah will cut his ties with the national team after the latest controversy, which was described as a “crisis” within the Egyptian media.

It is not the first time there has been tension between Salah and the Egyptian FA.

Salah and his representatives were increasingly unhappy at what they perceived as the Liverpool star being used as a political pawn by the Egyptian FA during the World Cup in Russia last year, which involved the Chechnya leader Ramzan Kadyrov.
description: The Premier League club had fears that Salah's presence at December's tournament would be used for propaganda purposes
